title: Edgecombe's 34 most in debut since Wilt in '59

title: A Human Leg In Garbage Truck Reveals A Horrifying Murder In Spain

content: In a breakthrough towards reaching thefirst-everreal-world application of quantum computing,GoogleQuantum AI'sWillowchiphasachievedthe "first-eververifiable quantum advantage."

title: Will AI Usage In Warehouses Cost Human Jobs? What Amazon Said
content: Amazon on Wednesday said it is speeding up the automation of its warehouses with the help of artificial intelligence and robotics, raising questions about the future of human workers.

title: "Hypocrisy": India Slams Pak For Passing Terrorism As "Freedom Struggle" At UN
content: India has slammed Pakistan at the United Nations (UN) for attempting to legitimise its cross-border terrorism under the guise of a "freedom struggle" and labeling its terrorist brigades as "freedom fighters".

title: 'Face Us If You're A Man': Pakistani Taliban's Open Threat To Asim Munir
content: A string of videos released by the Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) has put Pakistan's army chief, Field Marshal Asim Munir, in a spot.

content: She was once accused of seducing her way into the secrets of the West. Anna Chapman, the infamous red-haired Russian spy deported from the United States in 2010, has a new mission: to tell the story of those who never got caught.

title: Pics: INS Trikand Carries Out Firefighting Operation Off Djibouti Coast
content: Indian warship INS Trikand carried out a rescue mission on board a Cameroon-flagged commercial carrier off the coast of Djibouti after the vessel caught fire, in which two crew members were killed.

title: Uma Bharti Wants To Contest 2029 Polls From Jhansi, But There's A Rider
content: Former Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Uma Bharti has declared that she will contest the 2029 Lok Sabha elections from Jhansi.

title: 4 Most-Wanted Gangsters From 'Sigma Gang' Killed In Delhi Encounter
content: Four most wanted gangsters from Bihar were killed in a police encounter in Delhi early Thursday. They were wanted criminals in several heinous cases in Bihar.

title: 'Those Wanting BMWs...': Amitabh Kant Buys Mahindra EV Amid Lokpal Row
content: Amid the massive row over the Lokpal's plan to procure seven BMW luxury cars for its members, former NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant has announced that he has switched to an electric vehicle, and added that "those wanting to buy BMWs" should switch to EV

title: Politics Heats Up In Telangana After Cow Vigilante Allegedly Shot At By Cattle Smuggler
content: The attack on a cow vigilante near Hyderabad on Wednesday has led to a sharp political escalation in Telangana.

title: "Indian Died": Hyderabad Man, In Video, Says Don't Want To Fight For Russia
content: Mohammed Ahmed travelled to Russia from Telangana in April, hoping to find employment in the construction sector.

title: Meta To Cut 600 Jobs In AI Division To Streamline Operations
content: Facebook owner Meta is cutting 600 jobs in its artificial intelligence division in a move intended to streamline operations after an aggressive hiring spree, US media reported Wednesday.

title: North Korea Tests New Weapon System A Week Ahead Of APEC Summit
content: North Korea said on Thursday it had tested a "cutting-edge" new weapon system using hypersonic missiles aimed at bolstering its defences against Pyongyang's foes.

title: BJP Trying To Impose Their Preferred Officer As Top Cop In Tamil Nadu: DMK
content: The ruling DMK government has accused the BJP-led Union Government of attempting to impose its preferred officer as the next Director General of Police in Tamil Nadu.

content: The grandchildren of the last woman to be executed in Britain have called for Ruth Ellis to be pardoned, 70 years after she was sent to the gallows for murdering her "abusive" lover, their lawyers said Wednesday.

title: Ahead of pan-India SIR, Election Commission tracks voter mapping progress
content: The exercise involves standardising addresses and correcting discrepancies through house-to-house visits by booth-level officers

content: The northeast monsoon in its vigorous mode pounded most districts across the State. Periyakalapet in Puducherry recorded extremely heavy rainfall of 25 cm in the 24 hours ending 8:30 a.m. on October 22

content: The security guard, with the help of others, shifted Pawan to a near-by hospital where the doctors declared him as brought dead

title: Andhra Pradesh introduces Common Zoning Regulations to streamline urban development
content: They mark the first-ever uniform framework for all Urban Local Bodies and Urban Development Authorities, replacing multiple master plans that have long caused ambiguity and procedural delays ¬†

title: Monsoon cuts off 60 tribal families in Sathyamangalam Tiger Reserve
content: The hamlet is reachable only by crossing four streams that overflow during the October‚ÄìJanuary monsoon season. With the streams in spate, movement has become impossible

content: The August 12, 2025 notification allows for the cancellation of Overseas Citizenship of India status if a cardholder is chargesheeted for an offence carrying a sentence of seven years or more, even without a conviction

title: CM Naidu invites Sharaf Group to invest in A.P.
content: Sharaf Group expresses willingness to invest in logistics and warehouses in A.P., while Transworld Group is keen to partner in setting up shipbuilding unit at Dugarajapatnam

title: Landing of President‚Äôs helicopter  on newly-laid turf triggers row
content: The chopper had originally been scheduled to land at Nilakkal, but unfavourable weather forced a last-minute change. Officials clarified that the helipad had been completed only hours before the President‚Äôs arrival, and its surface had not fully set due to damp weather

title: Great Green Wall to protect Andhra Pradesh‚Äôs coastline from cyclones and environmental degradation
content: An initiative of the Department of Environment, Forests, Science & Technology, the project spanning 5 km will comprise a multi-layered green buffer zone having mangroves, shelterbelt plantations, inland vegetation, and sand dunes that will reduce the impact of cyclones and storm surges, and stabilise shorelines

title: Congress comes down on LDF over move to join PM-SHRI scheme
content: AICC general secretary alleges that CPI(M) is deviating from its professed principles by supporting the PM-SHRI scheme

title: No accurate data on number of migrant workers in State
content: Unified portal and mobile application and Kerala Interstate Migrant Workers Welfare Registration Ordinance still being readied

title: CPI State executive weighs the ‚Äòpros and cons‚Äô of signing up for the NEP-linked PM-SHRI scheme
content: Party feels the LDF government should be wary of rising to the Centre‚Äôs ‚ÄúNEP bait. States that committing to PM-SHRI will implicitly signal adherence to the NEP, which infringes on federalism and, at a stroke, negates cultural, ethnic and linguistic diversities by seeking to centralise school education

title: 'Joint PC? But only one pic': BJP mocks 'Mahagathbandhan' presser; poster shows only Tejashwi
content: The BJP mocked the Mahagathbandhan after a press conference poster featured only RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav, suggesting Rahul Gandhi and Congress were sidelined. The INDIA bloc appeared ready to announce Tejashwi as its chief ministerial candidate, with leaders meeting to resolve alliance stalemates and clear confusion ahead of Bihar Assembly elections.

title: 'Putin wasn't honest': Trump imposes heavy sanctions on Russian oil firms
content: The United States is imposing significant sanctions on Russia's top oil firms, Rosneft and Lukoil, due to President Putin's perceived lack of honest engagement in peace talks with President Trump. This action follows the collapse of ceasefire discussions and the cancellation of a planned Trump-Putin summit, signaling US frustration over the stalled peace negotiations.

title: Midnight blast halts trains in Assam: Track and sleepers destroyed near Kokrajhar
content: A massive blast, suspected to be from an IED, disrupted train services on the Northeast Frontier Railway early Thursday morning. The explosion damaged tracks between Salakati and Kokrajhar, causing an emergency halt to a goods train. While no casualties were reported, eight trains were detained, and security forces are investigating the serious security breach.

title: iPhone 17 Pro turns pink: Chemical reaction blamed; no fix yet
content: iPhone 17 Pro Cosmic Orange models are reportedly turning pink. This discoloration is linked to the porous nature of anodized aluminum, which can absorb chemicals like hydrogen peroxide found in some cleaning products. Apple advises against using such agents, recommending alcohol wipes instead. Owners are urged to handle devices with care to preserve the vibrant finish.

title: IND vs AUS 2nd ODI: Did Kohli just retire at the Adelaide Oval? Image goes viral
content: Virat Kohli endured a difficult return to international cricket, registering his second consecutive duck in the second ODI against Australia at Adelaide Oval. Dismissed by Xavier Bartlett, this marked a career first for the star batter. Despite the recent setbacks, Kohli's impressive past record at the venue remains a notable point.

title: False alarm: IMD red alert fizzles as Chennai sees light rain only; schools remain closed
content: Weather alerts for heavy rain in Tamil Nadu, including Chennai, proved largely inaccurate as a low-pressure system fizzled out. While some areas saw light showers, major warnings were downgraded. Experts cite the dynamic nature of weather systems and interactions between the Bay of Bengal and Arabian Sea for the forecast discrepancies.

title: Gang-raped, threatened: Woman sexually assaulted, robbed by 5 at Bengaluru home
content: A 27-year-old woman from Bengal was allegedly gang-raped and robbed at her Bengaluru residence on Tuesday night. Five individuals reportedly entered her home, sexually assaulted her, and fled with cash and mobile phones. Police have arrested three suspects and are actively searching for the remaining two. The survivor is reported to be out of danger.

title: China‚ÄìEU tech feud: VW, BMW brace for shortages; auto crisis looms
content: New Chinese export restrictions on chips and automotive components, triggered by the Dutch government's intervention in Nexperia, are causing concern for Europe's automotive supply chain. Volkswagen has warned of potential production stoppages due to chip shortages, while BMW and Mercedes-Benz are working to secure supplies amid escalating tech tensions.

title: Gold & silver price prediction: Will rates fall further? Here‚Äôs what you should know
content: Gold and silver price prediction today: Gold and silver prices are experiencing a downturn due to profit-taking after recent rallies. MCX Gold has corrected from ‚Çπ1,31,000 to ‚Çπ1,27,000, with potential further dips to ‚Çπ1,24,000. MCX Silver has fallen below $50 and ‚Çπ1,70,000, targeting ‚Çπ1,42,000. Global factors and Fed cues remain key influencers.

title: New blow: Kohli departs for duck; suffers never-seen-before embarrassment
content: Xavier Bartlett struck a significant blow in the second ODI, dismissing Virat Kohli for a golden duck with a well-executed lbw. This marks the first time in Kohli's illustrious 303-match career that he has been out for consecutive ducks, leaving the Indian contingent in disbelief.

title: Physics in action? Police steps in as IIT Guwahati students engage in rocket-war on Diwali
content: A Diwali celebration at IIT Guwahati devolved into a dangerous 'firecracker war' between students from two hostels. The chaotic scene, with rockets and crackers launched between buildings, necessitated police intervention. The incident, captured in a viral video, saw the campus sky lit up in a manner resembling a battlefield.

title: Reddit sues Perplexity; claims data theft for AI training, case filed in NY
content: Social media giant Reddit has filed a lawsuit against AI startup Perplexity and three data-scraping companies, alleging unlawful scraping of Reddit's data to train Perplexity's AI. Reddit claims these firms circumvented its protections to steal content, despite Perplexity lacking a license.

title: High speed, no helmets, damaged road: Murthal outing turns ugly as 3 friends die in crash
content: A tragic late-night ride ended in the deaths of three friends on the Libaspur flyover after their motorcycle crashed into a barrier. None of the victims were wearing helmets, highlighting a persistent disregard for road safety despite increased enforcement and awareness campaigns.  Excuses for not wearing helmets are common, even as fatalities rise.

title: 'Too poor to buy crackers': Punjab family makes bomb at home; explosion kills 1
content: During the lively Bandi Chhor Divas festivities in Dharmabad village, Gurdaspur, a heart-wrenching event transpired as a homemade explosive detonated, tragically taking one life and injuring six others. The device, reportedly constructed from an iron pipe and potash by brothers struggling with financial difficulties, went off unexpectedly during its ignition.

title: US Congress‚Äô H-1B wish-list to Trump and what they mean for Indian talent
content: Seven US lawmakers have urged President Trump to withdraw the proposed $100,000 H-1B visa fee and introduce reforms promoting fairer, more efficient immigration. Their proposals include stronger oversight of outsourcing firms, easier visa portability, updated wage tiers, and a balanced fee system ‚Äî measures that could reshape opportunities for Indian professionals and boost America‚Äôs innovation economy.

title: ‚ÄòLook at our neighbours‚Ä¶‚Äô: Ex-cricketer slams Cong spokesperson's remark on Sarfaraz Khan
content: Former cricketer Atul Wassan slammed Congress spokesperson Shama Mohamed's suggestion that Sarfaraz Khan's exclusion from India A squads was due to his religion. Wassan expressed shame over communal narratives entering cricket, emphasizing meritocracy and India's inclusive history in the sport. He stressed that selection debates are cricketing matters, not communal ones.

title: Delhi encounter: 4 Bihar-based criminals gunned down in joint police op
content: Four men wanted in Bihar for murder and other serious offenses were killed in an early morning encounter with Delhi Police and Bihar Police. The suspects allegedly opened fire when intercepted, leading to retaliatory action. At least two to three officers were injured during the operation.

title: Understanding LDL & HDL cholesterol and natural ways to protect your heart
content: Cholesterol, vital for cell health and hormone production, requires a delicate balance between LDL and HDL. High LDL clogs arteries, increasing heart risks, while HDL acts as a scavenger.  Simple lifestyle changes like fibre-rich meals, healthy fats, nuts, fruits, vegetables, and regular exercise can naturally manage cholesterol levels, safeguarding your heart health.

title: Delhi air pollution 2025: Doctors share who is most at risk and how to protect lungs
content: Delhi's air quality has plummeted, causing widespread respiratory distress and exacerbating existing health conditions. Vulnerable groups, including children, the elderly, and those with chronic illnesses, face heightened risks. Experts urge immediate preventive measures like staying indoors, wearing masks, and maintaining clean indoor air to mitigate the severe health impacts of the smog.

title: Stephen and Ayesha Curry divorce rumours denied after viral podcast remarks
content: Recent rumors of a Stephen and Ayesha Curry divorce were fueled by Ayesha's "Call Her Daddy" podcast comments about not wanting marriage or children. However, no evidence supports these claims, as their social media shows continued affection and family photos. Steph recently posted a tribute to Ayesha, calling her his 'rock'.

title: Knicks vs Cavaliers injury update: Hart, Robinson out; Towns uncertain
content: The NBA season kicks off with the New York Knicks hosting the Cleveland Cavaliers on October 22, 2025. Both teams face significant injury concerns, with the Knicks missing key players like Mitchell Robinson and Karl-Anthony Towns. The Cavaliers will also be without Darius Garland. Despite roster challenges, both sides aim for a strong opening performance at Madison Square Garden.

title: Daniel Naroditsky net worth 2025: Chess grandmaster‚Äôs income, death & legacy
content: Chess world mourns Daniel Naroditsky, a beloved American grandmaster and online teacher. Naroditsky, known for his clear lessons, died at 29. His estimated net worth in 2025 was one million dollars. He inspired countless players globally through YouTube, Twitch, and coaching. His passing leaves a void in the chess community, remembered for making the game accessible and enjoyable for all.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 crosses 26,000; BSE Sensex up over 500 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, soared in opening trade on Thursday. While Nifty50 went above 26,000, BSE Sensex was up over 500 points.

title: Two decades of declining education degrees: Is America running out of teachers?
content: A new AACTE analysis reveals a two-decade decline in US education degrees, signalling a shrinking teacher pipeline. Bachelor‚Äôs and master‚Äôs awards have dropped sharply, while enrolments in traditional programmes continue to fall. Alternative certification routes, however, are growing, alongside greater diversity among graduates. Experts warn that inadequate investment in teacher preparation could worsen America‚Äôs teacher shortage.

title: 'Down to nothing by year end': Trump's another crude claim on India's Russian oil imports
content: US President claims India will significantly reduce its Russian oil purchases by year-end, stating it's a gradual process. He also discussed China's relationship with Russia, suggesting it was forced by the previous administration and expressing hope for dialogue on ending the war in Ukraine.

title: 'He‚Äôs out of rhythm' ‚Äì Ex-India cricketer delivers harsh verdict on Virat Kohli
content: Virat Kohli's familiar struggle with deliveries outside off stump resurfaced in the first ODI against Australia, leading to a duck. Former player Mohammad Kaif attributes this to a lack of match practice, impacting Kohli's rhythm and anticipation. Despite this setback, Kohli aims to find form at Adelaide Oval, a venue where he has a strong record.

title: Bhai Dooj 2025: Top 50 wishes, messages and quotes to share with your loved ones
content: Bhai Dooj, celebrated two days after Diwali, honors the strong bond between brothers and sisters. This year, it falls on October 22, with sisters praying for their brothers' well-being and brothers pledging protection. The festival is a time for joy, gifts, and cherishing lifelong connections, even across distances.

title: Saudi Arabia appoints Sheikh Saleh bin Fawzan bin Abdullah Al-Fawzan as new Grand Mufti
content: Saudi Arabia, by royal decree issued by King Salman, has announced Sheikh Saleh bin Fawzan bin Abdullah Al-Fawzan as the new Grand Mufti. He succeeds the late Sheikh Abdulaziz Al-Sheikh and will serve as chairman of the Council of Senior Scholars and head of the Permanent Committee for Scholarly Research and Ifta, holding the rank of minister.

title: IND vs AUS: Rohit ‚Äòdeliberately underperforming‚Äô under Gill? India legend fires back
content: India's openers struggled in their first ODI against Australia, with Rohit Sharma scoring eight and Virat Kohli a duck. Speculation arose on social media about deliberate underperformance to challenge new captain Shubman Gill. However, Sunil Gavaskar dismissed these theories, emphasizing that players wouldn't risk their careers and highlighting the benefit of experienced leaders for Gill.

title: Flying with a power bank? New rules could ground your gadget
content: India is considering stricter rules for power banks on flights after a recent incident on an IndiGo flight. The Directorate General of Civil Aviation is reviewing technical inputs as foreign airlines like Emirates and Singapore Airlines have already implemented restrictions on power bank usage and charging onboard.

title: UP: BJP neta makes trader rub nose on road over parking row; arrested
content: A BJP office bearer in Meerut was arrested and removed from his post after forcing a businessman to publicly apologize by rubbing his nose on the road. The incident, captured on video, occurred outside a UP minister's office. Three police personnel present at the scene were also shunted for inaction.

title: Aaron Rodgers reacts hilariously after Steelers player tackles him mid-celebration
content: Steelers' Broderick Jones accidentally tackled Aaron Rodgers during a touchdown celebration, leading to a humorous exchange. Rodgers, unfazed, playfully warned his teammate about future collisions. Jones, embracing the moment, vowed to bring similar energy. This incident highlights the developing camaraderie within the team, even as Rodgers proves his enduring skill on the field.

title: 'Blot on humanity': Ill Dalit man made to lick urine after soiling temple stairs in UP
content: A 65-year-old Dalit man, suffering from illness, was allegedly forced to lick his own urine and clean temple stairs in Lucknow after an accident. The jewellery shop owner, Swami Kant, was arrested following a complaint. The incident has sparked outrage and calls for stringent action against caste-based humiliation.

title: Bihar polls: Tejashwi oppn's CM face? Answers at presser today, say INDIA allies
content: Tejashwi Yadav's declaration as the INDIA bloc's CM face in Bihar is imminent following crucial meetings between Congress leaders and RJD's Lalu Prasad. Allies express confidence in Tejashwi's leadership, with an official announcement expected soon. Congress assures unity and a strong electoral front for Bihar.

title: Choksi extradition: Swish prison cell awaits bizman ‚Äî Inside Mumbai‚Äôs Arthur Road jail
content: Fugitive Mehul Choksi's extradition to India will see him housed in a specially prepared cell at Arthur Road jail, designed to meet European prisoner standards.  Photographs reveal a surprisingly well-equipped dwelling with ample light, ventilation, and amenities, countering claims of poor jail conditions. This development follows a Belgian court's decision to uphold his extradition.

title: 'If you want trophy': New twist in Asia Cup row; Naqvi sends stern message to BCCI
content: A dispute has erupted between the BCCI and PCB over the Asia Cup trophy presentation. PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi insists on personally handing the trophy to India in Dubai on November 10, following India's refusal to accept it from him after their win. This stems from tensions between the Indian team and the ACC president.

title: Staggered pan-India SIR likely in a week, 3 months for each phase
content: A nationwide special intensive revision of electoral rolls is set to begin within days, mirroring Bihar's successful three-month process. This significant undertaking, the first in over two decades, aims to update voter lists across India. States facing immediate assembly polls will be prioritized, with a final roll expected by early next year.

title: 'Insult to Hindus': BJP after Kali idol 'desecrated' in Bengal; taken away in prison van
content: Desecration of a Goddess Kali idol in West Bengal's South 24 Parganas district sparked outrage, with the BJP accusing the TMC government of shielding culprits. Police are investigating the damaged idol, found in a village temple, and warned against misinformation. The incident occurred amidst protests and stone-pelting, leading to police intervention.

title: Army transforming its 382 infantry battalions with new weapons & drone platoons
content: the army is now progressively transforming its 382 infantry battalions to meet the myriad challenges of tech-driven warfare . focus is on lethality, mobility, battlefield transparency, situational awareness, survivability, training and restructuring . the infantry is by far the largest arm of the 11.5 lat.

title: Himachal shivers: Mercury drops after fresh snow, rain; Tabo below 0¬∞
content: tabo in lahaul & Spiti district was the coldest at minus 0.7 degrees Celsius . manali recorded a minimum temperature of 7.4 degrees, Shimla and Dharamshala 12.6 degrees each, and Kufri 10.9 degrees .

title: From braying to bye-ing: MP loses 94% of donkeys in 3 decades; now just 3,000 left
content: the state now has just 3,052 donkeys, a sharp fall from 49,289 in 1997 . nine of the 55 districts have reported zero donkey, signalling near-total disappearance of the animal that once powered rural India‚Äôs transport and trade . animal rights activist Naresh Kadyan had urged the Centre to declare donkey hide an endangered species .
